headline.title: Google DeepMind Unveils Gemini Ultra 2 with Real-Time Video Understanding
headline.summary: Google DeepMind has released Gemini Ultra 2, a multimodal AI model capable of understanding and reasoning about live video streams in real time. The model demonstrates unprecedented performance on complex visual reasoning tasks, outperforming previous benchmarks by 23%. Enterprise availability begins next month.

simpleSummary: Google made a super smart computer brain that can watch videos and understand what's happening, just like you can. It can answer questions about what it sees, almost like having a really clever friend watching TV with you who never misses a thing.

tools.title: Cursor 3.0 Launches with Multi-File Agent Mode
tools.summary: The AI code editor introduces an autonomous agent that can plan and execute changes across entire codebases, with built-in testing and rollback capabilities.

tools.title: Adobe Firefly Video Goes Live for All Creative Cloud Users
tools.summary: Adobe rolls out its AI video generation tool to all Creative Cloud subscribers, supporting 4K output and style-consistent generation across clips.

tools.title: Notion Launches AI-Powered Knowledge Graph
tools.summary: Notion's new feature automatically maps relationships between documents, creating a navigable knowledge graph that surfaces relevant context during writing.

tools.title: Perplexity Introduces Deep Research for Enterprise
tools.summary: Enterprise teams can now use Perplexity's multi-step research agent that produces 30-page reports with verified citations from proprietary data sources.

research.title: Stanford Researchers Achieve 10x Training Efficiency with Sparse Mixture Architecture
research.summary: A new training approach using dynamic sparsity reduces compute requirements by 90% while maintaining model quality, potentially democratizing large model training.

research.title: MIT Paper Proposes Constitutional AI 2.0 Framework
research.summary: Researchers introduce an improved framework for AI alignment that uses multi-agent debate to identify and resolve value conflicts in real time.

research.title: DeepSeek Open-Sources 671B Parameter MoE Model
research.summary: Chinese AI lab DeepSeek releases its largest model yet as open-source, with performance rivaling GPT-5 on coding and mathematical reasoning benchmarks.

business.title: NVIDIA Reports $52B Quarterly Revenue, AI Chip Demand 'Insatiable'
business.summary: NVIDIA smashes expectations with record quarterly earnings driven by data center GPU sales. CEO Jensen Huang announces next-generation Blackwell Ultra chips shipping in Q3.

business.title: Anthropic Closes $5B Series E at $80B Valuation
business.summary: The Claude maker secures its largest funding round to date, with investment from Google, Salesforce, and several sovereign wealth funds.

business.title: Apple Acquires AI Startup for On-Device Language Models
business.summary: Apple reportedly acquires a Paris-based startup specializing in efficient on-device language models, signaling deeper AI integration in upcoming iOS releases.

policy.title: EU AI Act Enforcement Begins with First Compliance Audits
policy.summary: European regulators launch their first round of compliance audits for high-risk AI systems, focusing on hiring algorithms and credit scoring models.

policy.title: US Senate Introduces Bipartisan AI Licensing Bill
policy.summary: A new bill proposes mandatory licensing for AI systems exceeding certain capability thresholds, with annual safety reviews required for frontier models.

concerns.title: Study Finds AI-Generated Misinformation Increasingly Difficult to Detect
concerns.summary: A Georgetown University study finds that AI-generated fake news articles are now indistinguishable from human-written content by both readers and detection tools in 78% of cases.

concerns.title: Major Copyright Lawsuit Against AI Training Data Reaches Supreme Court
concerns.summary: The landmark case over whether AI training on copyrighted works constitutes fair use will be heard by the Supreme Court, with implications for the entire generative AI industry.

concerns.title: Report: AI Automation Could Displace 30% of Knowledge Worker Tasks by 2028
concerns.summary: McKinsey's latest report estimates that generative AI will automate nearly a third of knowledge work tasks within two years, urging companies to invest in workforce reskilling.

quote.text: The question is no longer whether AI will transform every industry, but whether we'll manage that transformation wisely enough to benefit everyone.
quote.author: Dario Amodei
